text: Hezekiah Consults Isaiah
And this happened: When King Hezekiah heard, he tore his garments, covered himself with sackcloth, and entered the temple\f + \fr 37:1 \ft Or “house” \f* of Yahweh.

And he sent Eliakim, who \add was\add* ⸤in charge of⸥\f + \fr 37:2 \ft Literally “over” \f* the palace,\f + \fr 37:2 \ft Or “house” \f* and Shebna the secretary, and the elders of the priests ⸤covered⸥\f + \fr 37:2 \ft Literally “covering themselves” \f* with sackcloth to Isaiah son of Amoz, the prophet.

And they said to him, “Thus says Hezekiah: ‘This day \add is\add* a day of distress, rebuke, and disgrace, for children have come to \add the\add* cervical opening, and there is no strength to give birth.

Maybe Yahweh your God heard \add the\add* words of Rabshakeh whom the king of Assyria, his master, has sent to taunt \add the\add* living God, and he will rebuke the words that Yahweh your God hears. And you must lift up a prayer for the benefit of the remnant that is found.’ ”
When\f + \fr 37:5 \ft Or “And” \f* the servants of King Hezekiah came to Isaiah,

Isaiah said to them, “You must say this to your master: ‘Thus says Yahweh: “You must not be afraid because of the words that you have heard, \add with\add* which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.

Look! I \add am\add* about to ⸤put⸥\f + \fr 37:7 \ft Literally “give” \f* a spirit in him ⸤so that⸥\f + \fr 37:7 \ft Or “and” \f* he shall hear a rumor and he shall return to his land, and I will cause him to fall by the sword in his land.” ’ ”
And Rabshakeh returned and found the king of Assyria fighting against Libnah, for he had heard that he had left from Lachish.
Now\f + \fr 37:9 \ft Or “And” \f* he\f + \fr 37:9 \ft That is, the king \f* heard concerning Tirhakah the king of Cush, saying, “He has set out to fight against\f + \fr 37:9 \ft Or “with” \f* you.”
When\f + \fr 37:9 \ft Or “And” \f* he heard \add it\add*, he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,
“You shall say this to Hezekiah, king of Judah: ‘\add Do\add* not let your God in whom you trust in him deceive you by saying, “Jerusalem will not be given into the hand of the king of Assyria.”
Look! you have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all lands to destroy them, and you—shall you be delivered?
Did the gods of the nations that my ⸤predecessors⸥\f + \fr 37:12 \ft Literally “fathers” \f* destroyed deliver them—Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the sons of Eden who \add were\add* in Telassar?
Where \add is\add* the king of Hamath, the king of Arpad, the king of the city of Sepharvaim, Hena, or\f + \fr 37:13 \ft Or “and” \f* Ivvah?’ ”
Hezekiah’s Prayer

And Hezekiah took the letter from the hand of the messengers, and he read\f + \fr 37:14 \ft Or “called” \f* it. Then\f + \fr 37:14 \ft Or “And” \f* he went up \add to\add* the temple\f + \fr 37:14 \ft Or “house” \f* of Yahweh, and Hezekiah spread it out before the ⸤presence⸥\f + \fr 37:14 \ft Literally “face” \f* of Yahweh.
And Hezekiah prayed to Yahweh, saying,

“Yahweh of hosts, God of Israel ⸤who is enthroned on⸥\f + \fr 37:16 \ft Literally “sitting” \f* the cherubim, you \add are\add* the one, God by yourself, of all the kingdoms of the earth; you are the one who made the heavens and the earth.
Yahweh, extend your ear and hear! Yahweh, open your eyes and see, and hear all the words of Sennacherib that he has sent to taunt the living God!
Truly, Yahweh, the kings of Assyria have laid waste all the lands\f + \fr 37:18 \ft The parallel text in 2 Kings has “nations” \f* and their land,
to ⸤set⸥\f + \fr 37:19 \ft Literally “give” \f* their gods in the fire, for they \add were\add* not gods, but \add the\add* work of human hands, wood and stone, and they destroyed them.
So\f + \fr 37:20 \ft Or “And” \f* now, Yahweh, our God, save us from his hand so that\f + \fr 37:20 \ft Or “and” \f* all the kingdoms of the earth may know that you \add are\add* Yahweh, you alone!”
God’s Answer
And Isaiah son of Amoz sent to Hezekiah, saying, “Thus says Yahweh the God of Israel: ‘Because you have prayed to me ⸤concerning⸥\f + \fr 37:21 \ft Literally “to” \f* Sennacherib, king of Assyria,
this \add is\add* the word that Yahweh has spoken concerning him:
She shows contempt for you; she derides you, virgin daughter of Zion;
she shakes \add her\add* head behind you, daughter of Jerusalem.
Whom have you taunted and blasphemed,
and against whom have you raised up \add your\add* voice and lifted your eyes upward?
To the holy one of Israel!
By the hand of your servants you have taunted the Lord,
and you have said, “With my many chariots,\f + \fr 37:24 \ft Hebrew “chariot” \f*
I myself have gone up \add the\add* height of \add the\add* mountains,
\add to\add* the remote areas of Lebanon.
And I cut off ⸤its tall cedars⸥,\f + \fr 37:24 \ft Literally “the height of its cedars” \f*
the choicest of its junipers.
And I came \add to\add* the height of its limit,
the forest of its orchard.\f + \fr 37:24 \ft Or “Carmel” \f*
I myself dug and drank waters,
and I caused all the streams of Egypt to dry up by the sole of my feet.”
Have you not heard from ⸤a long time ago⸥?\f + \fr 37:26 \ft Literally “distant” \f* I have made it
from days of primeval time, and I formed it.
Now I have brought it \add about\add*,
and it is for fortified cities to collapse into heaps of destroyed stones.
And their inhabitants \add are\add* ⸤weak⸥;\f + \fr 37:27 \ft Literally “short of hand” \f*
they are dismayed, and they are ashamed;
they have become \add like\add* plants\f + \fr 37:27 \ft Hebrew “plant” \f* of \add the\add* field,
and \add like\add* greens of grass,
\add like\add* grass on\f + \fr 37:27 \ft Or “of” \f* \add the\add* roofs
and a cultivated field ⸤before⸥\f + \fr 37:27 \ft Literally “before the face of” \f* the standing grain.
And I know your sitting down and your going out,
and your coming in, and your raging ⸤against⸥\f + \fr 37:28 \ft Literally “to” \f* me.
Because you were enraged ⸤against⸥\f + \fr 37:29 \ft Literally “to” \f* me,
and your noise\f + \fr 37:29 \ft Or “complacency” \f* has come up to\f + \fr 37:29 \ft Literally “in” \f* my ears,
I will put my hook in your nose
and my bridle on your lips,
and I will turn you back
on the way \add by\add* which you came.

And this \add shall be\add* the sign for you: the eating of volunteer plants\f + \fr 37:30 \ft Hebrew “plant” \f* this\f + \fr 37:30 \ft Literally “the” \f* year, and in the second year self-seeded plants,\f + \fr 37:30 \ft Hebrew “plant” \f* and in the third year sow, reap, plant vineyards, and eat their fruit.
And the remnant of the house of Judah that remain shall ⸤grow⸥\f + \fr 37:31 \ft Literally “add” \f* roots\f + \fr 37:31 \ft Hebrew “root” \f* downwards and make fruit upwards.
For a remnant shall go out from Jerusalem
and survivors\f + \fr 37:32 \ft Hebrew “survivor” \f* from mountain Zion.
The zeal of Yahweh of hosts will do this.’
Therefore thus says Yahweh concerning\f + \fr 37:33 \ft Or “to” \f* the king of Assyria:
‘He shall not come to this city,
and he shall not shoot an arrow there,
and he shall not meet it \add with\add* a shield,
and he shall not heap a siege ramp up against her.
He shall return by the way that he came,
and he shall not come to this city,’
⸤declares⸥\f + \fr 37:34 \ft Literally “declaration of” \f* Yahweh.
‘And I will defend this city, to save it for my sake and for the sake of David, my servant.’ ”
Sennacherib’s Defeat

And the angel of Yahweh set out and struck one hundred and eighty-five thousand in the camp of the Assyrians. When\f + \fr 37:36 \ft Or “And” \f* they rose in the morning, look! All of them \add were\add* dead corpses.
Then\f + \fr 37:37 \ft Or “And” \f* Sennacherib king of Assyria left, went, and returned and lived at Nineveh.

And this happened: he \add was\add* bowing in worship \add in\add* the house of Nisroch his god, and Adrammelech and Sharezer, his sons, struck him with the sword. And they themselves escaped \add to\add* the land of Ararat, and Esar-haddon his son reigned as king in his place.
